page.title: 16CRAMOND :Dalmeny Estate
page.content: On 14 June four of us went to Dalmeny Estate to interview the factor, Mr Findlay and to meet Lady Rosebery if she was there. We drove along all the small estate roads before going to the Home Farm. Mr Findlay told us there were 1700 acres in the park and that there was more arable land than woodland. The trees grown are for hardwood which is sold to make furni- ture. There is a seven year rotation of crops, grass,wheat,barley, then potatoes or turnips if there is a disease that affects potatoes. There is a 9 hole golf course for the family and the tenants of the 24 houses on the estate and for all the employees.
